oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Intravenous Insulin Infusion
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schall, William D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ketoacidosis
insulin dosage
low dose infusion
intravenous injection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Diabetic Ketoacidosis has traditionally been treated by intermittent intravenous bolus administration of regular insulin. Recently, the efficacy and convenience of low dose intravenous insulin infusion has been reported as used in man and dogs. The advantages of low dose infusion in man compared to intermittent intravenous injection have been reported.
